name: Jason Amundson
bio: Professor of Geophysics at the University of Alaska Southeast, whose research explores glacier dynamics, glacier hydrology, and glacier-ocean interactions.

name: Gabriel Wolken
affiliation: University of Alaska Fairbanks and Alaska Division of Geological & Geophysical Surveys
bio: Research Professor and manager of the State of Alaska's Climate and Cryosphere Hazards Program whose research explores the evolving climate, its effects on the cryosphere, and the resulting hazards that threaten our planet.

name: David Rounce
bio: Assistant Professor of Civil and Environmental Engineering at Carnegie Mellon University, whose research explores glacier projections and glacier outburst floods through the integration of fieldwork, remote sensing, and models.

name: Eran Hood
bio: Professor of Environmental Science and Department Chair at University of Alaska Southeast. His research interests include watershed-scale hydrology and biogeochemistry, and snow hydrology. He has spent more than 20 years studying the Icefield-to-Ocean ecosystems in the Coast Mountains of southeast Alaska.

name: Morgan Abbruscato
bio: PhD Student at Carnegie Mellon University in Environmental Engineering whose research explores glacierâ€“lake interactions and their implications for glacier evolution and hazard assessment in a changing climate.

name: Sean Fagan
bio: Researcher at University of Alaska Southeast. The lead programmer for the Alaska Glacial Lake Flood Dashboard and Juneau Glacial Flood Dashboard, platforms designed to improve public access to real-time flood risk data and hazard forecasts.

name: David Polashenski
bio: David Polashenski is a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Alaska Southeast. His research focuses on ice dynamics and glaciology, with an emphasis on monitoring glacier change and associated hazards.
